DOC.brief_title: Training Based On Declarative Memory Cues Improved Gait In Patients With Parkinson 's Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Deficits automatic motor control , characteristic Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) , contribute progressive impairment gait performance . The use declarative memory cue order promote engagement attention activation next movement gait may minimize consequence lack automatic control . Objectives : To verify long-term efficiency new strategy base declarative memory cue improve gait performance independence daily life activity ( DLA ) patient PD . Design : Parallel prospective , single blind , randomize clinical trial . Setting : Brazilian Parkinson Association . Participants : Forty-four patient PD stage 2-3 disease evolution accord Hoehn Yahr Classification Interventions : The experimental training ( ET ) consist eight gait train session , twice week , use declarative memory cue strategy ( DMCS ) . The control training ( CT ) consist similar gait training without DMCS . Primary outcome measure : Gait performance term speed stride length . Secondary outcome measure : Independence DLA accord Section II Unified Parkinson 's Disease Rating Scale . Randomization : Participants randomize control group ( CG ) , perform CT , experimental group ( EG ) , perform ET , blind draw names . Statistical analysis : The gait performance ADL independence , 2 60 day end training compare CG EG use Repeated-measures analysis variance ( RM-ANOVA ) .
